public ClassBoundaryAspect()
Method Detail

callOfClassBoundaryPointcut

public static boolean callOfClassBoundaryPointcut(java.lang.Object calledObj,
                                                  java.lang.Object callerObj)
Pointcut intercepting the call of methods non private and non static to the classes annotated with the ClassBoundary annotations. 
  AspectJ pointcut:
   call(!private !static * 
   (@org.aoplib4j.modularity.ClassBoundary *).*(..)) 
   && target(calledObj) && this(callerObj) && if()

Parameters:
calledObj - instance of the called object.
callerObj - instance of the caller object.
Returns:
false if calledObject == callerObject (the call is made on the class instance) or if the retrieved ClassBoundary annotation from the called class is null.

callOfStaticClassBoundaryPointcut

public static boolean callOfStaticClassBoundaryPointcut(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
Pointcut intercepting the call of methods non private and static to the classes annotated with the ClassBoundary annotations. 
  AspectJ pointcut:
    call(!private static * 
    (@org.aoplib4j.modularity.ClassBoundary *).*(..))
    && if()

Parameters:
jpsp - AspectJ join point static part.
Returns:
false if the ClassBoundary annotation retrieved from the calledClass is null true otherwise.

callOfClassBoundaryAdvice

public void callOfClassBoundaryAdvice(java.lang.Object calledObj,
                                      java.lang.Object callerObj,
                                      org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint jp)
Advice for the execution of the callOfClassBoundaryPointcut(Object, Object) pointcut. The advice compute the called class informations (using the calledObj parameter), the caller class informations (using the callerObj parameter) and then checks if the caller class is present or not into the list of forbidden classes. If the caller is present into the list of forbidden classes, the framework creates an instance of BoundaryViolationCallback (using as implementation class taken from ClassBoundary.callbackClass() ) and call the callback method #boundaryViolation( org.aoplib4j.modularity.ViolationInformation)

Parameters:
calledObj - the instance of the called object
callerObj - the instance of the caller object
jp - the AspectJ join point.

callOfStaticClassBoundaryAdvice

public void callOfStaticClassBoundaryAdvice(org.aspectj.lang.JoinPoint.StaticPart jpsp)
Advice executed before the execution of a static method found on an annotated class. The advice retrieve the called informations using the JoinPoint.StaticPart object. Since static pointcuts cannot retrieve the caller object using this pointcut the caller information is computed using the stack trace of the current execution thread by creating a new Throwable object and calling Throwable.getStackTrace(). (see AbstractBoundary.getCallerInformation(String, String)). After the caller and called classes are computed a violation check is made. In the case of a violation, the framework creates an instance of BoundaryViolationCallback (using as implementation class taken from ClassBoundary.callbackClass( )) and call the callback method #boundaryViolation( org.aoplib4j.modularity.ViolationInformation)

Parameters:
jpsp - AspectJ join point static part.
See Also:
classBoundaryViolated(String, ClassBoundary), BoundaryViolationCallback

getClassBoundaryAnnotation

private static ClassBoundary getClassBoundaryAnnotation(java.lang.Class<?> calledClass)
Method that returns the ClassBoundary annotation from the object passed as parameter or null if the class is not annotated.

Parameters:
calledClass - the class from which the annotation should be retrieved.
Returns:
attached ClassBoundary or null.

classBoundaryViolated

private boolean classBoundaryViolated(java.lang.String callerClassName,
                                      ClassBoundary classBoundary)
Verifies the violation of class boundary by retrieving the information from the ClassBoundary annotation (the classes list, the list type) and comparing with the class name passed as parameter.

Parameters:
classBoundary - ClassBoundary annotation.
callerClassName - caller class name.
Returns:
true if a boundary violation; false otherwise.
